title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: [[Australia]]: [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] [[Scott Morrison]] said he planned on remaining neutral, not commenting on the protests; Leader of the Opposition [[Anthony Albanese]] urged votes to be counted: "People shouting in a chant stop the count - that's really shouting stop democracy. [...] America will come through this." <ref>{{Cite web|last=Stayner|first=Tom|title=Scott Morrison says 'it's not for him' to speculate on Donald Trump's claims of electoral fraud|url=https://www.sbs.com.au/news/scott-morrison-says-it-s-not-for-him-to-speculate-on-donald-trump-s-claims-of-electoral-fraud|access-date=2020-11-05|website=SBS News|language=en-AU}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: * {{flag|Australia}}: [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] [[Scott Morrison]] said he planned on remaining neutral, not commenting on the protests; Leader of the Opposition [[Anthony Albanese]] urged votes to be counted: "People shouting in a chant stop the count - that's really shouting stop democracy. [...] America will come through this." <ref>{{Cite web|last=Stayner|first=Tom|title=Scott Morrison says 'it's not for him' to speculate on Donald Trump's claims of electoral fraud|url=https://www.sbs.com.au/news/scott-morrison-says-it-s-not-for-him-to-speculate-on-donald-trump-s-claims-of-electoral-fraud|access-date=2020-11-05|website=SBS News|language=en-AU}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted: Observers had been suggesting for months about the possibility of a premature Trump victory claim and then a contested election based on the likelihood that the initial votes counted by Election Night would skew heavily Republican. This was because [[mail-in voting|mail-in ballots]] were expected to lean heavily Democratic, leading to a [[blue shift (politics)|blue shift]] that becomes more favorable to Biden as more votes are counted.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Chang|first=Alvin|date=2020-11-01|title='Blue shift': why votes counted after election day skew to the Democrats|language=en-GB|work=The Guardian|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/nov/01/why-itll-be-normal-if-results-shift-in-the-days-after-the-election|access-date=2020-11-05|issn=0261-3077}}</ref>

* {{flag|Australia}}: [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] [[Scott Morrison]] said he planned on remaining neutral, not commenting on the protests;<ref name= ScoMoNotSpeculateClaimsOfFraud>{{Cite web|last=Stayner|first=Tom|title=Scott Morrison says 'it's not for him' to speculate on Donald Trump's claims of electoral fraud|url=https://www.sbs.com.au/news/scott-morrison-says-it-s-not-for-him-to-speculate-on-donald-trump-s-claims-of-electoral-fraud|access-date=2020-11-05|website=SBS News|language=en-AU}}</ref> Leader of the Opposition [[Anthony Albanese]] urged all votes to be counted: "People shouting in a chant stop the count - that's really shouting stop democracy. [...] America will come through this."<ref name="ScoMoNotSpeculateClaimsOfFraud" /> [[Marise Payne]], similar to Scott Morrison, refused to provide a "running commentary" but expressed the importance of every vote being counted.<ref name= MarisePayneInterviewed>{{Cite web|author=Department of Foreign Affairs & Trade|title=Interview with Lisa Millar, ABC News Breakfast|url=https://www.foreignminister.gov.au/minister/marise-payne/transcript/interview-lisa-millar-abc-news-breakfast|access-date=2020-11-05|website=Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade|language=en-AU}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted: In remarks from the [[White House]] on the early hours of November 4, President Trump attacked the vote counting efforts, calling it "fraud" with no basis. The president remarked, "We will win this. As far as I'm concerned, we already have won."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Videos|first= Ian Schwartz, RCP|title=Trump: "We Did Win This Election," "This Is A Major Fraud On Our Nation"|url= https://www.https://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2020/11/04/trump_we_did_win_this_election_this_is_a_major_fraud_on_our_nation.html|website= Real Clear Politics}}</ref> The major networks carried Trump's speech in full, but aired fact-checks after it had concluded.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Business|first=Brian Stelter, CNN|title=What will TV and social networks do if Trump prematurely declares victory?|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/02/media/tv-networks-election-night-victory/index.html|access-date=2020-11-05|website=CNN}}</ref> Furthermore, former [[Counselor to the President|White House Chief Strategist]] [[Steve Bannon]] suggested violence against Dr. [[Anthony Fauci]] and FBI Director [[Christopher A. Wray]] could serve as “a warning to federal bureaucrats” to begin a second term for President Trump.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Reimann|first=Nicholas|title=Steve Bannon Condemned, Banned From Twitter After Suggesting Violence As ‘A Warning To Federal Bureaucrats’|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/nicholasreimann/2020/11/05/steve-bannon-condemned-banned-from-twitter-after-suggesting-violence-as-a-warning-to-federal-bureaucrats/|access-date=2020-11-06|website=Forbes|language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: * In Oregon, protestors targeted a city commissioners house in [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]] before setting fire to the [[Portland City Hall (Oregon)|Portland City Hall.]]<ref>{{Cite web|last=News|first=A. B. C.|title=Protesters in Portland target a city commissioner's home, set fire to city hall|url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/protesters-portland-target-city-commissioners-home-set-fire/story?id=74054924|access-date=2020-11-06|website=ABC News|language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: *In [[Detroit]], 200 pro-Trump protesters, some armed with pistols, rallied outside the tally room at [[TCF Center]] as the former Vice President Joe Biden took the vote count lead.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Witsil|first=Omar Abdel-Baqui, Slone Terranella and Frank|title=Protesters rally at TCF Center as Biden's lead overtakes Trump in key states|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/local/michigan/detroit/2020/11/06/protesters-rally-tcf-center-detroit-biden-ballots/6186881002/|access-date=2020-11-07|website=USA TODAY|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted: *In Portland, protesters vandalized a city commissioner's house before setting fire to [[Portland City Hall (Oregon)|City Hall.]]<ref>{{Cite web|last=News|first=A. B. C.|title=Protesters in Portland target a city commissioner's home, set fire to city hall|url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/protesters-portland-target-city-commissioners-home-set-fire/story?id=74054924|access-date=2020-11-06|website=ABC News|language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: * [[Facebook]] banned a group page called "Stop the Steal", which was used by Trump supporters to organize protests against the election results after his allegations of electoral fraud. It achieved 300,000 followers before Facebook shut it down, citing calls for violence by some participants.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Kelly|first=Makena|date=2020-11-05|title=Facebook shuts down huge "Stop the Steal" group|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/11/5/21551551/facebook-stop-the-steal-group-misinformation-election-2020|access-date=2020-11-07|website=The Verge|language=en}}</ref>

* Police acting on a tip alleging a group plotted to attack the [[Pennsylvania Convention Center]] in [[Philadelphia]], where votes were being counted, arrested two armed men for firearm violations; another gun was found in their Hummer.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Conley|first=Lisa|date=2020-11-06|title=Philadelphia police investigating alleged plot to attack convention center where ballots are being counted|url=https://thehill.com/homenews/news/524753-philadelphia-police-investigating-alleged-plot-to-attack-convention-center|access-date=2020-11-06|website=TheHill|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Brooks|first=Bob|last2=Davis|first2=Corey|date=November 6, 2020|title=Police thwart alleged plot to attack Pa. Convention Center where votes are being counted in Philly|url=https://6abc.com/7689932/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=November 6, 2020|website=6abc Philadelphia|language=en}}</ref>

*In Portland, protesters vandalized a city commissioner's house before setting fire to [[Portland City Hall (Oregon)|City Hall.]]<ref>{{Cite web|last=News|first=A. B. C.|title=Protesters in Portland target a city commissioner's home, set fire to city hall|url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/protesters-portland-target-city-commissioners-home-set-fire/story?id=74054924|access-date=2020-11-06|website=ABC News|language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: *In [[Little Rock]], a group of around 50 Trump supporters, many of whom were armed, were met with a smaller group of counter-protestors at the [[Arkansas State Capitol]] building. <ref>https://katv.com/news/local/demonstrators-gather-at-arkansas-state-capitol-following-election-announcement</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: *In [[Youngstown|Youngstown, OH]], about 50 pro-Trump protesters rallied outside the [[WKBN-TV|WKBN]] TV news station. The protests were peaceful.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Protesters supporting Trump gather outside WKBN|url=https://www.wkbn.com/news/elections/protesters-supporting-trump-gather-outside-wkbn/|access-date=2020-11-07|website=WKBN|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: * Pro Trump Protests were held in Arizona, Pennsylvania and Michigan. In one of them radio show host [[Alex Jones]] called on protesters to in his own words to ‘Surround The White House And Support The President’.<ref>https://www.forbes.com/sites/jemimamcevoy/2020/11/06/alex-jones-calls-on-pro-trump-protesters-to-surround-the-white-house-and-support-the-president/?sh=4fdc1e4c3023</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: *In [[Lansing, Michigan|Lansing]], more than 500 Trump supporters protested at the state [[Michigan State Capitol|Capitol]] over what they consider to be a rigged presidential race that led to Biden's election as the president.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Martinez|first=Mark Johnson and Christian|title=Michigan protest: Trump supporters in Lansing rally against election results as race is called for Joe Biden|url=https://www.lansingstatejournal.com/story/news/2020/11/07/lansing-michigan-protestors-rally-against-election-results-joe-biden-appears-win/6202486002/|access-date=2020-11-08|website=Lansing State Journal|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted: * In [[Seattle]], eight protesters were arrested.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Staff|first=KIRO 7 News|title=8 arrested in Seattle election night protests|url=https://www.kiro7.com/news/local/8-arrested-seattle-election-night-protests/DH2EH2QE5VFHXN5KKMKOR4NC2U/|access-date=2020-11-05|website=KIRO|language=en-US|archive-date=November 5, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201105001501/https://www.kiro7.com/news/local/8-arrested-seattle-election-night-protests/DH2EH2QE5VFHXN5KKMKOR4NC2U/|url-status=live}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: [[Category:Controversies of the 2020 United States presidential election]]

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: In [[Dallas]], demonstrators marched to Dallas City Hall to demand that every vote be counted<ref>{{Cite web|title=Demonstrators at Dallas City Hall demand that all votes be counted as outcome of presidential race nears|url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/elections/2020/11/04/demonstrators-rally-at-dallas-city-hall-to-demand-all-votes-be-counted-as-outcome-of-presidential-race-nears/|access-date=2020-11-15|website=Dallas News|language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: *In [[Dallas]], demonstrators marched to Dallas City Hall to demand that every vote be counted<ref>{{Cite web|title=Demonstrators at Dallas City Hall demand that all votes be counted as outcome of presidential race nears|url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/elections/2020/11/04/demonstrators-rally-at-dallas-city-hall-to-demand-all-votes-be-counted-as-outcome-of-presidential-race-nears/|access-date=2020-11-15|website=Dallas News|language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted: In [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]] hundreds of [[anarchists]] and [[anti-fascists]] protested throughout Portland, against both presidential candidates. Protesters carried signs stating "Strong communities make politicians obsolete", "We don't want Biden we want revenge", and chanted "fuck Biden". Protesters began [[rioting]] near an ICE detention center facility, and the [[Oregon Army National Guard]] was sent into Portland. 17 protesters were arrested.<ref>https://www.theglobeandmail.com/world/us-politics/article-police-arrest-11-in-portland-50-in-new-york-at-protests-after-us/</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: * To stop the vote count (for most Trump supporters in Michigan, Pennsylvania)

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: *In [[Pittsburgh]], Multiple protests were organized by several groups like Pittsburgh United, United Steelworkers, Pennsylvania Interfaith Impact Network, and Bend the Arc to “count every vote.”<ref>{{Cite web|last=Haile|first=Nardos|title=Over 100 protest in Pittsburgh, calling on Pennsylvania to "Count Every Vote"|url=https://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/over-100-protest-in-pittsburgh-calling-on-pennsylvania-to-count-every-vote/Content?oid=18314866|access-date=2020-11-16|website=Pittsburgh City Paper|language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
added: The weekend after the election, Infowars host Alex Jones, along with crew members Owen Shroyer and Ali Alexander, announced they would send a caravan of vehicles from Austin, TX to Washington D.C. starting the next day to rally support for Donald Trump (https://parler.com/post/4e08833557c6497c839511f82f4dfeb9). Infowars contributor Ali Alexander suggested / started the hashtag #marchfortrump, and announced a march for Trump in Washington D.C., scheduled for Saturday, November 14.  The march was not anticipated to be massive at that time.  Infowars publicized the event for the first time on Sunday, 11/8/2020.  The next day, upon hearing about the ‘Stop the Steal Caravan’ and the ‘March For Trump,’ alt-pop musician Adam Metropolis started the hashtag #millionMAGAmarch on Parler, and began making promo images & videos for that concept.  Metropolis did this completely independently, having no relationship with Infowars.  The origin of the name ‘Million MAGA March’ was on Monday, 11/9 (https://parler.com/post/07bc7707d42a4f5397dc4ae1d2afecaf).

The concept was, according to Adam, to create a manipulative title that would encourage Trump-supporters to think the turn-out was going to be good, so they would be more likely to go.  It was also to anger media outlets to increase coverage.

Adam pushed promos on the social media platforms Parler, Minds, MeWe, and Gab. Harrison Smith, an Infowars anchor, saw the hashtag and began using the term “Million MAGA March” live on air during Infowars’ “The War Room” on Monday, 11/9. At this time there was still no time or location set for the so-called ‘Million MAGA March.’   The next day, the Proud Boys had announced “The Million MAGA March” publicly, and the event spread virally on Parler & Minds.

Adam Metropolis contacted news sources in the US and internationally, giving a news tip about a horrible Trump rally where there would be no masks or social distancing.  He did this under ghe pseudonym ‘Calvin Ennis.’  (All outgoing emails can be forwarded for historical record.)

Soon, viral content was promoting “Global Protests” (https://parler.com/post/186071c90bb944bea625ed01ed62f125 ) and called for people around the world to rise up against COVID19 lockdowns.  The event was seen as a revolt against global government, not merely a rally event for Trump.

Because this event was first announced on Sunday, 11/8, and considering the nature of its evolution into what it became, it is of historical significance.  Far-right conspiracy theorist Alex Jones gave the keynote speech at the steps of the Supreme Court, in which he expressed at least two overt calls for violence, mentioning Bill Gates by name (https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=youtu.be&v=wDXe6XhsoGU&app=desktop).  He claims Donald Trump won the election, and He calls Joe Biden “a Chinese spy” and claims Biden’s family members are “Satanic pedophiles,” to roaring applause.
Media outlets are consistently claiming a turnout of thousands, but review of the UK Guardian footage reveals more than 100,000 in Freedom Plaza an hour before the event began.
Mayor Muriel Bowser shut down 10 blocks of Washington D.C. for the March, and also partially suspended  Metrorail service the morning of the event.
Alex Jones gave a bullhorn speech in Freedom Plaza at 11:45am (https://parler.com/post/edb8475eadcd4ba1bddfe68fc5344079 )
The march started at around noon. Footage:  The procession went uphill to the Supreme Court, with new supporters flowing in until at least 2 p.m.
Police estimated total turnout to be over a million:   (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Esy3Dak7uXs&app=desktop)
Jones had at least 30 Proud Boys protecting him, and video footage from Parler reveals at least 300 Proud Boys / 3% / Oathkeepers wearing body armor at the event. (Parler: # millionMAGAmarch)
The following shows some of the turnout, both photographed pointing downhill:
The next night, pro-Trump protesters showed up at the Clintons’ house to harass them:  https://parler.com/post/186071c90bb944bea625ed01ed62f125

Whatvis striking is that a handful of activists threw together a protest of over a million people in 6 days - and it was completely decentralized.  There were still no permits relating to the March as of Wed, Nov 11 (https://www.washingtonian.com/2020/11/11/million-maga-march-organizers-still-dont-have-a-permit/).

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted:
The [[Donald Trump 2020 presidential campaign|Trump campaign]] has challenged the legitimacy of the election results by filing lawsuits, demanding [[Election recount|recounts]], alleging that [[Postal voting in the United States|mail voting]] is responsible for widespread electoral fraud, and claiming without evidence that election officials are conspiring to help Democrats.{{Cite news |last=Young |first=Ashley |date=September 23, 2016 |title=A Complete Guide To Early And Absentee Voting |language=en |url=https://www.npr.org/2016/09/23/491999689/a-complete-guide-to-early-and-absentee-voting |access-date=June 15, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116035304/https://www.npr.org/2016/09/23/491999689/a-complete-guide-to-early-and-absentee-voting |url-status=live }}(1) {{Cite web|last=Farley|first=Robert|date=April 10, 2020|title=Trump's Latest Voter Fraud Misinformation|url=https://www.factcheck.org/2020/04/trumps-latest-voter-fraud-misinformation/|website=FactCheck.org|language=en-US|access-date=June 19, 2020|archive-date=November 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116035239/https://www.factcheck.org/2020/04/trumps-latest-voter-fraud-misinformation/|url-status=live}}
(2) {{cite news|date=July 30, 2020|title=Donald Trump suggests delay to 2020 US presidential election|work=BBC News|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53597975|accessdate=July 31, 2020|archive-date=July 30, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200730223245/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53597975|url-status=live}}
(3) {{Cite news|last=Morello|first=Carol|date=November 4, 2020|title=European election observers decry Trump’s ‘baseless allegations’ of voter fraud|language=en-US|work=Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/election-observers-trump-allegations/2020/11/04/4a538500-1ee0-11eb-9ec3-3a81e23c4b5e_story.html|url-status=live|access-date=November 6, 2020|issn=0190-8286|archive-date=November 5, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201105161029/https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/election-observers-trump-allegations/2020/11/04/4a538500-1ee0-11eb-9ec3-3a81e23c4b5e_story.html}}
(4) {{cite web|first=Chris|last=Cillizza|title=Here's the *real* reason Donald Trump is attacking mail-in ballots|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/26/politics/mail-in-ballot-vote-by-mail-trump/index.html|date=May 26, 2020|access-date=June 29, 2020|website=CNN|archive-date=July 30, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200730153554/https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/26/politics/mail-in-ballot-vote-by-mail-trump/index.html|url-status=live}}
(5) {{cite news|last1=Haberman|first1=Maggie|last2=Corasaniti|first2=Nick|last3=Qiu|first3=Linda|date=June 24, 2020|title=Trump's Attacks on Voting by Mail Stir Broad Concern|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/us/politics/trump-vote-by-mail.html|access-date=June 29, 2020|issn=0362-4331|archive-date=July 29, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200729030608/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/us/politics/trump-vote-by-mail.html|url-status=live}} Trump has consistently refused to commit to a [[United States presidential transition|transfer of power]].{{cite news|last=King|first=Ledyard|date=November 7, 2020|title=Trump revives baseless claims of election fraud after Biden wins presidential race|work=USA Today|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/11/07/joe-biden-victory-president-trump-claims-election-far-over/6202892002/|accessdate=November 7, 2020|archive-date=November 8, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201108054219/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/11/07/joe-biden-victory-president-trump-claims-election-far-over/6202892002/|url-status=live}}

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted: *Spontaneous celebrations were held in [[Washington, D.C.]],<ref>{{cite news |last1=Grablick |first1=Colleen |last2=Sadon |first2=Rachel |title=DC Erupts In Celebration As Joe Biden Wins Presidency |url=https://dcist.com/story/20/11/07/joe-biden-wins-presidency-dc-celebrates/ |accessdate=November 8, 2020 |work=[[DCist]] |date=November 7, 2020 |language=en |archive-date=November 8, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201108054116/https://dcist.com/story/20/11/07/joe-biden-wins-presidency-dc-celebrates/ |url-status=dead }}</ref> and other major American cities after major networks projected a Biden victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=Popping champagne and dancing, people take to the streets across the US to celebrate Biden, Harris win |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/11/07/biden-and-harris-win-2020-election-people-celebrate-streets/6202739002/ |accessdate=November 8, 2020 |work=[[USA Today]] |date=November 7, 2020 |language=en |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116183951/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/11/07/biden-and-harris-win-2020-election-people-celebrate-streets/6202739002/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

title: 2020–21 United States election protests
deleted:
The [[Donald Trump 2020 presidential campaign|Trump campaign]] has challenged the legitimacy of the election results by filing lawsuits, demanding [[Election recount|recounts]], alleging that [[Postal voting in the United States|mail voting]] is responsible for widespread electoral fraud, and claiming without evidence that election officials are conspiring to help Democrats.{{Cite news |last=Young |first=Ashley |date=September 23, 2016 |title=A Complete Guide To Early And Absentee Voting |language=en |url=https://www.npr.org/2016/09/23/491999689/a-complete-guide-to-early-and-absentee-voting |access-date=June 15, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116035304/https://www.npr.org/2016/09/23/491999689/a-complete-guide-to-early-and-absentee-voting |url-status=live }}(1) {{Cite web|last=Farley|first=Robert|date=April 10, 2020|title=Trump's Latest Voter Fraud Misinformation|url=https://www.factcheck.org/2020/04/trumps-latest-voter-fraud-misinformation/|website=FactCheck.org|language=en-US|access-date=June 19, 2020|archive-date=November 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116035239/https://www.factcheck.org/2020/04/trumps-latest-voter-fraud-misinformation/|url-status=live}}
(2) {{cite news|date=July 30, 2020|title=Donald Trump suggests delay to 2020 US presidential election|work=BBC News|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53597975|accessdate=July 31, 2020|archive-date=July 30, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200730223245/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53597975|url-status=live}}
(3) {{Cite news|last=Morello|first=Carol|date=November 4, 2020|title=European election observers decry Trump’s ‘baseless allegations’ of voter fraud|language=en-US|work=Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/election-observers-trump-allegations/2020/11/04/4a538500-1ee0-11eb-9ec3-3a81e23c4b5e_story.html|url-status=live|access-date=November 6, 2020|issn=0190-8286|archive-date=November 5, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201105161029/https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/election-observers-trump-allegations/2020/11/04/4a538500-1ee0-11eb-9ec3-3a81e23c4b5e_story.html}}
(4) {{cite web|first=Chris|last=Cillizza|title=Here's the *real* reason Donald Trump is attacking mail-in ballots|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/26/politics/mail-in-ballot-vote-by-mail-trump/index.html|date=May 26, 2020|access-date=June 29, 2020|website=CNN|archive-date=July 30, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200730153554/https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/26/politics/mail-in-ballot-vote-by-mail-trump/index.html|url-status=live}}
(5) {{cite news|last1=Haberman|first1=Maggie|last2=Corasaniti|first2=Nick|last3=Qiu|first3=Linda|date=June 24, 2020|title=Trump's Attacks on Voting by Mail Stir Broad Concern|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/us/politics/trump-vote-by-mail.html|access-date=June 29, 2020|issn=0362-4331|archive-date=July 29, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200729030608/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/us/politics/trump-vote-by-mail.html|url-status=live}} Trump has consistently refused to commit to a [[United States presidential transition|transfer of power]].{{cite news|last=King|first=Ledyard|date=November 7, 2020|title=Trump revives baseless claims of election fraud after Biden wins presidential race|work=USA Today|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/11/07/joe-biden-victory-president-trump-claims-election-far-over/6202892002/|accessdate=November 7, 2020|archive-date=November 8, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201108054219/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/11/07/joe-biden-victory-president-trump-claims-election-far-over/6202892002/|url-status=live}}
